cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 300 miles ESE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking WNW–NW across the east-central Gulf today, then slowing and bending NNW toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast LA‒MS coast) Monday night into Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the MS/LA coast between Grand Isle, LA and Ocean Springs, MS

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Ocean Springs, MS to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning east of Ocean Springs, MS to Indian Pass, FL; Storm Surge Watch MS/AL border to AL/FL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle, including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible at Mobile by late Monday night and could persist into Tuesday; a low (≈5%) risk of 50-kt gusts exists if Sally strengthens near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 2–4 ft above ground level is possible along the MS/AL border to the AL/FL border, including Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast totals 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts, producing flash and urban flooding in the Mobile area Tuesday–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Monday; possible river flooding later in the week as heavy rainfall drains inland.
